WHG

Class Ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • WHG.Block
      • WHG.Ball
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Renderable, Updateable

    public class Ball
extends Block
implements Renderable, Updateable
    This class is used to draw and update the blue balls in the game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Ball(double x, double y, double w, double h, javafx.scene.paint.Color col, double xsp, double ysp)
      Initialization constructor to construct a ball.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas, javafx.scene.paint.Color col)
      This method draws the ball on the screen with another blue oval a few frames inside the ball as all the balls in the game are drawn with a black color so that the ball has a blue center and a black outline.
      double getOriginalX()
      This is used to get the original x position of the ball.
      double getOriginalXSpeed()
      This is used to get the original xSpeed of the ball.
      double getOriginalY()
      This is used to get the original y position of the ball.
      double getOriginalYSpeed()
      This is used to get the original ySpeed of the ball.
      double getXSpeed()
      This is used to get the xSpeed of the ball.
      double getYSpeed()
      This is used to get the ySpeed of the ball.
      void onCollision(Block block)
      This is used to check for collisions between other blocks and set the speed to its opposite speed accordingly if a collision is detected.
      void setOrigianlYSpeed(double oysp)
      This sets the original y speed of the ball and is used to keep track of the original speed in level five so that the balls can freeze and then reset with their original speed.
      void setOriginalX(double ox)
      This sets the original x position of the ball and is used to keep track of the original position in level five so that when the balls reset, they can go back to their original position.
      void setOriginalXSpeed(double oxsp)
      This sets the original x speed of the ball and is used to keep track of the original speed in level five so that the balls can freeze and then reset with their original speed.
      void setOriginalY(double oy)
      This sets the original y position of the ball and is used to keep track of the original position in level five so that when the balls reset, they can go back to their original position.
      void setXSpeed(double xsp)
      This sets the x speed of the ball.
      void setYSpeed(double ysp)
      This sets the y speed of the ball.
      void update(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)
      This method updates the ball location as it moves.

      • Methods inherited from class WHG.Block

        checkCollision, getBounds, getColor, getHeight, getWidth, getX, getY, setColor, setHeight, setWidth, setX, setY

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ball

        public Ball(double x,
            double y,
            double w,
            double h,
            javafx.scene.paint.Color col,
            double xsp,
            double ysp)
        Initialization constructor to construct a ball. It extends block but since it moves, it needs an x speed and a y speed.
        Parameters:
        x - is the x position.
        y - is the y position.
        w - is the width.
        h - is the height.
        col - is the color.
        xsp - is the x speed.
        ysp - is the y speed.

    • Method Detail

      • setXSpeed

        public void setXSpeed(double xsp)
        This sets the x speed of the ball.
        Parameters:
        xsp - is the speed that will be set to the instance variable.

      • setYSpeed

        public void setYSpeed(double ysp)
        This sets the y speed of the ball.
        Parameters:
        ysp - is the speed that will be set to the instance variable.

      • setOriginalXSpeed

        public void setOriginalXSpeed(double oxsp)
        This sets the original x speed of the ball and is used to keep track of the original speed in level five so that the balls can freeze and then reset with their original speed.
        Parameters:
        oxsp - is the speed that will be set to the instance variable.

      • setOrigianlYSpeed

        public void setOrigianlYSpeed(double oysp)
        This sets the original y speed of the ball and is used to keep track of the original speed in level five so that the balls can freeze and then reset with their original speed.
        Parameters:
        oysp - is the speed that will be set to the instance variable.

      • setOriginalX

        public void setOriginalX(double ox)
        This sets the original x position of the ball and is used to keep track of the original position in level five so that when the balls reset, they can go back to their original position.
        Parameters:
        ox - is the position that will be set to the instance variable.

      • setOriginalY

        public void setOriginalY(double oy)
        This sets the original y position of the ball and is used to keep track of the original position in level five so that when the balls reset, they can go back to their original position.
        Parameters:
        oy - is the position that will be set to the instance variable.

      • onCollision

        public void onCollision(Block block)
        This is used to check for collisions between other blocks and set the speed to its opposite speed accordingly if a collision is detected.
        Specified by:
        onCollision in class Block
        Parameters:
        block - is the block in which the ball is checking the collision against.

        Parameters:

      • draw

        public void draw(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas,
                 javafx.scene.paint.Color col)
        This method draws the ball on the screen with another blue oval a few frames inside the ball as all the balls in the game are drawn with a black color so that the ball has a blue center and a black outline.

        Parameters:
